clinical_study.brief_title: Intracapsular Tonsillectomy in the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Intracapsular Tonsillectomy in the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Treating sleep apnea in adults caused by tonsillar hypertrophy with intracapsular tonsillectomy by coblation

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators aim to study if good surgical results can be achieved by intracapsular tonsillectomy with coblation while monitoring safety, efficiency and cost-effectiveness. In adult tonsil surgery, the current practice in Finland is commonly extracapsular tonsillectomy with monopolar electrosurgery.

primary_outcome.description: Post-operative apnea-hypopnea index reduction by 50% compared to preoperative values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured by Glasgow Benefit Inventory
secondary_outcome.description: General quality of life questionnaire. 18 questions, score 1-5 in each question, higher is better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured by Nordic tonsil surgery register questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Questions regarding postoperative complications and perceived symptom relief after 180 days. Yes/no questions and open questions, no score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured by Epworth sleepiness scale
secondary_outcome.description: Questions regarding sleepiness. Score 0-24, lower is better.
Recovery speed defined as score 3 or less at rest; or 5 or less without regular analgesics use, questionnaire used: Brief Pain Inventory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total recovery of obstructive sleep apnea

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by photography, Friedman scale (0-4, lower is smaller).

intervention.description: Intracapsular removal of tonsillar tissue (>90%) with coblation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 16-64
- Planned tonsil surgery with informed concent
- Obstructive sleep apnea (AHI > 15)
- Tonsillar size of 3-4 on the Friedman scale
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 35 (Based on finnish Käypä Hoito -recommendations)
- Central sleep apnea
- Weight loss of more than 10% within the study period
- Untreated obstruction of nasal breathing
- Treated peritonsillar abscess <1 month before enrollment
- Active tonsillar infection
- Previous tonsillar surgery (excluding incision of abscess)
- Malignancy
- High use of analgesics >1 DDD daily during last 4 weeks
- Untreated reflux
- Anticoagulative medication
- Any condition of hemophilia
- Pregnancy, lactation
- Other, evaluated by treating physician
